review: I prefer the Fire TV stick over any type of media device (Chromecast, Apple TV, Roku, etc).The Fire TV stick can be used as a standalone device with the remote. I don't have to have my tablet or phone around in order to launch apps or watch Netflix, etc. Half of the time, my devices are rarely charged and always running on low battery. I love the remote that comes with this device. It can be used for everything. For some odd reason, I never lose it either. It is comfortably small.You can download apps to the Fire TV stick. I was amazed at this. I tried a demo of "You Don't Know Jack" and "Fibbage" and ended up having to purchase the entire 2015 Party Pack for $24.99. Guests are amazed at how innovative these games are. You can connect to the Fire TV with your cell phones and devices and play games in conjunction with your TV. It's so hilarious and entertaining. Yes, I know you can do something similar like this with Chromecast, but the quality of the apps available for the Amazon Fire series are jaw dropping. You can download a fireplace app or an aquarium app to play on your TV, etc.For the price, it is so worth it. I recommend it over and over to all of my friends looking for something that is affordable and capable of playing Netflix, Hulu, etc. You get so much more than what it is priced for. Why buy something that costs more than this?!
